glsa.title: KDE Personal Information Management Suite Remote Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: KDE-PIM may be vulnerable to a remote buffer overflow attack that may allow unauthorized access to an affected system.

background.p: KDE-PIM is an application suite designed to manage mail, addresses, appointments, and contacts.

description.p: A buffer overflow may occur in KDE-PIM's VCF file reader when a maliciously crafted VCF file is opened by a user on a vulnerable system.

impact.p: A remote attacker may unauthorized access to a user's personal data or execute commands with the user's privileges.

workaround.p: A workaround is not currently known for this issue. All users are advised to upgrade to the latest version of the affected package.

resolution.p: KDE users should upgrade to version 3.1.5 or later:
